title: Program for Improving Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills Using Self-Regulated Learning Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience using fundamental online learning tools
context.additional_context: Learners develop self-regulated learning strategies while performing work-integrated math projects. Real-time feedback and peer assessments are facilitated via digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze their self-regulated learning strengths/weaknesses with 80% accuracy through survey-based self-diagnosis.
Learners complete PBL tasks while applying five metacognitive strategies—planning, time management, feedback incorporation, etc.—at over 70% proficiency during mathematical problem-solving.
Learners can autonomously establish and execute weekly learning plans for over 5 hours using digital tools.

resources: Korean version of the CEVEAPEU questionnaire

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
